verses.textEn: The living, the living, these will give praise to you, as I also do this day! The father will make the truth known to the sons.
verses.textLa: Vivens, vivens ipse confitebitur tibi, sicut et ego hodie: pater filiis notam faciet veritatem tuam.

verses.textEn: O Lord, save me! And we will sing our psalms, all the days of our life, in the house of the Lord.”
verses.textLa: Domine salvum me fac, et psalmos nostros cantabimus cunctis diebus vitæ nostræ in domo Domini.

verses.textEn: Now Isaiah had ordered them to take a paste of figs, and to spread it like plaster over the wound, so that he would be healed.
verses.textLa: Et iussit Isaias ut tollerent massam de ficis, et cataplasmarent super vulnus, et sanaretur.

verses.textEn: And Hezekiah said, “What will be the sign that I may go up to the house of the Lord?”
verses.textLa: Et dixit Ezechias: Quod erit signum quia ascendam in domum Domini?

verses.textEn: At that time, Merodach Baladan, the son of Baladan, the king of Babylon, sent letters and gifts to Hezekiah. For he had heard that he had fallen ill and had recovered.
verses.textLa: In tempore illo misit Merodach Baladan filius Baladan rex Babylonis, libros et munera ad Ezechiam: audierat enim quod ægrotasset, et convaluisset.

verses.textEn: And Hezekiah rejoiced over them, and he showed them the storehouses of his aromatic spices, and of the silver and gold, and of the perfumes and precious ointments, and all the repositories for his belongings, and all the things that were found in his treasures. There was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah did not show them.
verses.textLa: Lætatus est autem super eis Ezechias, et ostendit eis cellam aromatum, et argenti, et auri, et odoramentorum, et unguenti optimi, et omnes apothecas supellectilis suæ, et universa quæ inventa sunt in thesauris eius. Non fuit verbum, quod non ostenderet eis Ezechias in domo sua, et in omni potestate sua.

verses.textEn: Then Isaiah the prophet entered before king Hezekiah, and he said to him, “What did these men say, and from where did they come to you?” And Hezekiah said, “They came to me from a far away land, from Babylon.”
verses.textLa: Introivit autem Isaias propheta ad Ezechiam regem, et dixit ei: Quid dixerunt viri isti, et unde venerunt ad te? Et dixit Ezechias: De terra longinqua venerunt ad me, de Babylone.

verses.textEn: And he said, “What did they see in your house?” And Hezekiah said: “They have seen all the things that are in my house. There was nothing that I did not show them among my treasures.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit: Quid viderunt in domo tua? Et dixit Ezechias: Omnia, quæ in domo mea sunt, viderunt: non fuit res, quam non ostenderim eis in thesauris meis.

verses.textEn: And Isaiah said to Hezekiah: “Hear the word of the Lord of hosts:
verses.textLa: Et dixit Isaias ad Ezechiam: Audi verbum Domini exercituum.

verses.textEn: Behold, the days are coming when all that is in your house, and all that your fathers have stored up, even to this day, will be taken away to Babylon. There will be nothing left behind, says the Lord.
verses.textLa: Ecce dies venient, et auferentur omnia, quæ in domo tua sunt, et quæ thesaurizaverunt patres tui usque ad diem hanc, in Babylonem: non relinquetur quidquam, dicit Dominus.

verses.textEn: And your children, who will issue from you, whom you will produce, they will be taken away. And they will become eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.”
verses.textLa: Et de filiis tuis, qui exibunt de te, quos genueris, tollent, et erunt eunuchi in palatio regis Babylonis.

verses.textEn: And Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The word of the Lord which he has spoken is good.” And he said, “But let there be peace and truth in my days.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit Ezechias ad Isaiam: Bonum verbum Domini quod locutus est. Et dixit: Fiat tantum pax, et veritas in diebus meis.

verses.textEn: “Be consoled, be consoled, O my people!” says your God.
verses.textLa: Consolamini, consolamini popule meus, dicit Deus vester.

verses.textEn: Speak to the heart of Jerusalem, and call out to her! For her malice has reached its end. Her iniquity has been forgiven. She has received double for all her sins from the hand of the Lord.
verses.textLa: Loquimini ad cor Ierusalem, et advocate eam: quoniam completa est malitia eius, dimissa est iniquitas illius: suscepit de manu Domini duplicia pro omnibus peccatis suis.

verses.textEn: The voice of one crying out in the desert: “Prepare the way of the Lord! Make straight the paths of our God, in a solitary place.
verses.textLa: Vox clamantis in deserto: Parate viam Domini, rectas facite in solitudine semitas Dei nostri.

verses.textEn: Every valley will be exalted, and every mountain and hill will be brought low. And the crooked will be straightened, and the uneven will become level ways.
verses.textLa: Omnis vallis exaltabitur, et omnis mons et collis humiliabitur, et erunt prava in directa, et aspera in vias planas.

verses.textEn: And the glory of the Lord will be revealed. And all flesh together will see that the mouth of the Lord has spoken.”
verses.textLa: Et revelabitur gloria Domini, et videbit omnis caro pariter quod os Domini locutum est.

verses.textEn: The voice of one saying, “Cry out!” And I said, “What should I cry out?” “All flesh is grass, and all its glory is like the flower of the field.
verses.textLa: Vox dicentis: Clama. Et dixi: Quid clamabo? Omnis caro fœnum, et omnis gloria eius quasi flos agri.

verses.textEn: The grass has dried up, and the flower has fallen. For the Spirit of the Lord has blown over it. Truly, the people are like grass.
verses.textLa: Exiccatum est fœnum, et cecidit flos, quia spiritus Domini sufflavit in eo. Vere fœnum est populus:

verses.textEn: The grass has dried up, and the flower has fallen. But the Word of our Lord remains for eternity.”
verses.textLa: exiccatum est fœnum, et cecidit flos: Verbum autem Domini nostri manet in æternum.

verses.textEn: You who evangelize Zion, climb a high mountain! You who evangelize Jerusalem, lift up your voice with strength! Lift it up! Do not be afraid! Say to the cities of Judah: “Behold, your God!”
verses.textLa: Super montem excelsum ascende, tu qui evangelizas Sion: exalta in fortitudine vocem tuam, qui evangelizas Ierusalem: exalta, noli timere. Dic civitatibus Iuda: Ecce Deus vester:

verses.textEn: Behold, the Lord God will arrive in strength, and his arm will rule. Behold, his reward is with him, and his work is before him.
verses.textLa: ecce Dominus Deus in fortitudine veniet, et brachium eius dominabitur: ecce merces eius cum eo, et opus illius coram illo.

verses.textEn: He will pasture his flock like a shepherd. He will gather together the lambs with his arm, and he will lift them up to his bosom, and he himself will carry the very young.
verses.textLa: Sicut pastor gregem suum pascet: in brachio suo congregabit agnos, et in sinu suo levabit, fœtas ipse portabit.

verses.textEn: Who has measured the waters in the hollow of his hand, and who has weighed the heavens with his palm? Who has suspended the mass of the earth with three fingers, and who has weighed the mountains on a balance and the hills on a scale?
verses.textLa: Quis mensus est pugillo aquas, et cælos palmo ponderavit? Quis appendit tribus digitis molem terræ, et liberavit in pondere montes, et colles in statera?

verses.textEn: Who has assisted the Spirit of the Lord? Or who has been his counselor and has revealed things to him?
verses.textLa: Quis adiuvit spiritum Domini? Aut quis consiliarius eius fuit, et ostendit illi?

verses.textEn: With whom has he consulted? And who has instructed him, and taught him the path of justice, and guided him to knowledge, and revealed the way of understanding to him?
verses.textLa: Cum quo iniit consilium? Et instruxit eum, et docuit eum semitam iustitiæ, et erudivit eum scientiam, et viam prudentiæ ostendit illi?

verses.textEn: Behold, the nations are like a drop of water in a bucket, and they are considered as the smallest grain on a balance. Behold, the islands are like a little dust.
verses.textLa: Ecce gentes quasi stilla situlæ, et quasi momentum stateræ reputatæ sunt: ecce insulæ quasi pulvis exiguus.

verses.textEn: And Lebanon will not be sufficient to start a fire, and its animals will not be sufficient for a burnt offering.
verses.textLa: Et Libanus non sufficiet ad succendendum, et animalia eius non sufficient ad holocaustum.

verses.textEn: All the nations in his sight are as if they did not exist, and they are considered by him as if they were nothingness and emptiness.
verses.textLa: Omnes gentes quasi non sint, sic sunt coram eo, et quasi nihilum et inane reputatæ sunt ei.

verses.textEn: Therefore, to whom would you liken God? Or with what image would you replace him?
verses.textLa: Cui ergo similem fecisti Deum? Aut quam imaginem ponetis ei?

verses.textEn: Should the workman cast a statue? Or has the goldsmith formed it with gold, or the silversmith with plates of silver?
verses.textLa: Numquid sculptile conflavit faber? Aut aurifex auro figuravit illud, et laminis argenteis argentarius?

verses.textEn: He has chosen strong wood that will not decay. The skillful artisan seeks a way to set up an idol that cannot be moved.
verses.textLa: Forte lignum, et imputribile elegit: artifex sapiens quærit quomodo statuat simulacrum, quod non moveatur.

verses.textEn: Do you not know? Have you not heard? Has it not been announced to you from the beginning? Have you not understood the foundations of the earth?
verses.textLa: Numquid non scitis? Numquid non audistis? Numquid non annunciatum est vobis ab initio? Numquid non intellexistis fundamenta terræ?

verses.textEn: He is the One who sits upon the globe of the earth, and its inhabitants are like locusts. He extends the heavens as if they were nothing, and he spreads them out like a tent, in which to dwell.
verses.textLa: Qui sedet super gyrum terræ, et habitatores eius sunt quasi locustæ: qui extendit velut nihilum cælos, et expandit eos sicut tabernaculum ad inhabitandum.

verses.textEn: He has brought those who examine what is secret to nothingness. He has brought the judges of the earth to emptiness.
verses.textLa: Qui dat secretorum scrutatores quasi non sint, iudices terræ velut inane fecit:

verses.textEn: And certainly, their stalk was neither planted, nor sown, nor rooted in the ground. He has suddenly blown across them, and they have withered, and a whirlwind will carry them away like chaff.
verses.textLa: et quidem neque plantatus, neque satus, neque radicatus in terra truncus eorum: repente flavit in eos, et aruerunt, et turbo quasi stipulam auferet eos.

verses.textEn: “And to whom would you compare me or equate me?” says the Holy One.
verses.textLa: Et cui assimilastis me, et adæquastis, dicit Sanctus?

verses.textEn: Lift up your eyes on high, and see who has created these things. He leads forth their army by number, and he calls them all by name. Because of the fullness of his strength and robustness and virtue, not one of them was left behind.
verses.textLa: Levate in excelsum oculos vestros, et videte quis creavit hæc: qui educit in numero militiam eorum, et omnes ex nomine vocat: præ multitudine fortitudinis et roboris, virtutisque eius, neque unum reliquum fuit.

verses.textEn: Why do you say this, O Jacob, and why do you speak this way, O Israel? “My way has been hidden from the Lord, and my judgment escaped notice by my God.”
verses.textLa: Quare dicis Iacob, et loqueris Israel: Abscondita est via mea a Domino, et a Deo meo iudicium meum transivit?

verses.textEn: Do you not know, or have you not heard? The Lord is the eternal God, who has created the limits of the earth. He does not diminish, and he does not struggle. Neither is his wisdom searchable.
verses.textLa: Numquid nescis, aut non audisti? Deus sempiternus Dominus, qui creavit terminos terræ: non deficiet, neque laborabit, nec est investigatio sapientiæ eius.

verses.textEn: It is he who gives strength to the weary, and it is he who increases fortitude and strength in those who are failing.
verses.textLa: Qui dat lasso virtutem: et his, qui non sunt, fortitudinem et robur multiplicat.

verses.textEn: Servants will struggle and fail, and young men will fall into infirmity.
verses.textLa: Deficient pueri, et laborabunt, et iuvenes in infirmitate cadent.

verses.textEn: But those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will take up wings like eagles. They will run and not struggle. They will walk and not tire.
verses.textLa: Qui autem sperant in Domino, mutabunt fortitudinem, assument pennas sicut aquilæ, current et non laborabunt, ambulabunt et non deficient.

verses.textEn: Let the islands be silent before me, and let the nations take new strength. Let them draw near, and then speak. Let us apply for judgment together.
verses.textLa: Taceant ad me insulæ, et gentes mutent fortitudinem: accedant, et tunc loquantur, simul ad iudicium propinquemus.

verses.textEn: Who has raised up a just man from the east, and has called him to follow him? He will place the nations under his gaze, and he will rule over kings. He will cause them to be like dust before his sword, like chaff driven by the wind before his bow.
verses.textLa: Quis suscitavit ab Oriente iustum, vocavit eum ut sequeretur se? Dabit in conspectu eius gentes, et reges obtinebit: dabit quasi pulverem gladio eius, sicut stipulam vento raptam arcui eius.
verses.notes: In my interpretation, this passage refers to the great Catholic monarch, to his war, and to his subsequent reign in peace.

verses.textEn: He will pursue them. He will pass by in peace. No trace will appear after his feet.
verses.textLa: Persequetur eos, transibit in pace, semita in pedibus eius non apparebit.

verses.textEn: Who has worked and accomplished these things, calling to the generations from the beginning? “It is I, the Lord! I am the first and the last.”
verses.textLa: Quis hæc operatus est, et fecit, vocans generationes ab exordio? Ego Dominus, primus et novissimus ego sum.

verses.textEn: The islands saw it and were afraid. The ends of the earth were stupefied. They drew near and arrived.
verses.textLa: Viderunt insulæ, et timuerunt, extrema terræ obstupuerunt, appropinquaverunt, et accesserunt.

verses.textEn: Each one will help his neighbor and will say to his brother, “Be strengthened.”
verses.textLa: Unusquisque proximo suo auxiliabitur, et fratri suo dicet: Confortare.

verses.textEn: The coppersmith striking with the mallet encouraged him who was forging at that time, saying, “It is ready for soldering.” And he strengthened it with nails, so that it would not be moved.
verses.textLa: Confortavit faber ærarius percutiens malleo eum, qui cudebat tunc temporis, dicens: Glutino bonum est: et confortavit eum clavis, ut non moveretur.

verses.textEn: But you, O Israel, are my servant, O Jacob, whom I have chosen, the offspring of my friend Abraham.
verses.textLa: Et tu Israel serve meus, Iacob quem elegi, semen Abraham amici mei:

verses.textEn: For his sake, I have taken you from the ends of the earth, and I have called you from its distant places. And I said to you: “You are my servant. I have chosen you, and I have not cast you aside.”
verses.textLa: In quo apprehendi te ab extremis terræ, et a longinquis eius vocavi te, et dixi tibi: Servus meus es tu, elegi te, et non abieci te.

verses.textEn: Do not be afraid, for I am with you. Do not turn away, for I am your God. I have strengthened you, and I have assisted you, and the right hand of my just one has upheld you.
verses.textLa: Ne timeas, quia ego tecum sum: ne declines, quia ego Deus tuus: confortavi te, et auxiliatus sum tibi, et suscepit te dextera iusti mei.

verses.textEn: Behold, all who fight against you shall be confounded and ashamed. They will be as if they did not exist, and the men who contradict you will perish.
verses.textLa: Ecce confundentur et erubescent omnes, qui pugnant adversum te: erunt quasi non sint, et peribunt viri, qui contradicunt tibi.

verses.textEn: You will seek them, and you will not find them. The men who rebel against you will be as if they did not exist. And the men who make war against you will be like something that has been consumed.
verses.textLa: Quæres eos, et non invenies, viros rebelles tuos: erunt quasi non sint: et veluti consumptio homines bellantes adversum te.

verses.textEn: For I am the Lord your God. I take you by your hand, and I say to you: Do not be afraid. I have helped you.
verses.textLa: Quia ego Dominus Deus tuus apprehendens manum tuam, dicensque tibi: Ne timeas, ego adiuvi te.

verses.textEn: Fear not, O worm of Jacob, you who are dead within Israel. I have helped you, says the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.textLa: Noli timere vermis Iacob, qui mortui estis ex Israel: ego auxiliatus sum tibi, dicit Dominus: et Redemptor tuus Sanctus Israel.

verses.textEn: I have established you like a new threshing cart, having serrated blades. You will thresh the mountains and crush them. And you will turn the hills into chaff.
verses.textLa: Ego posui te quasi plaustrum triturans novum, habens rostra serrantia: triturabis montes, et comminues: et colles quasi pulverem pones.

verses.textEn: You will winnow them, and the wind will blow them away, and the whirlwind will scatter them. And you shall exult in the Lord; you shall rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
verses.textLa: Ventilabis eos, et ventus tollet, et turbo disperget eos: et tu exultabis in Domino, in Sancto Israel lætaberis.

verses.textEn: The indigent and the poor are seeking water, but there is none. Their tongue has been dried up by thirst. I, the Lord, will heed them. I, the God of Israel, will not abandon them.
verses.textLa: Egeni, et pauperes quærunt aquas, et non sunt: lingua eorum siti aruit. Ego Dominus exaudiam eos, Deus Israel non derelinquam eos.

verses.textEn: I will open rivers in the high hills, and fountains in the midst of the plains. I will turn the desert into pools of water, and the impassable land into streams of water.
verses.textLa: Aperiam in supinis collibus flumina, et in medio camporum fontes: ponam desertum in stagna aquarum, et terram inviam in rivos aquarum.

verses.textEn: I will plant the cedar in a deserted place, with the thorn, and the myrtle, and the olive tree. In the desert, I will plant the pine, and the elm, and the box tree together,
verses.textLa: Dabo in solitudinem cedrum, et spinam, et myrtum, et lignum olivæ: ponam in deserto abietem, ulmum, et buxum simul:

verses.textEn: so that they may see and know, acknowledge and understand, together, that the hand of the Lord has accomplished this, and that the Holy One of Israel has created it.
verses.textLa: Ut videant, et sciant, et recogitent, et intelligant pariter quia manus Domini fecit hoc, et Sanctus Israel creavit illud.

verses.textEn: Bring your case forward, says the Lord. Bring it here, if you have anything to allege, says the King of Jacob.
verses.textLa: Prope facite iudicium vestrum, dicit Dominus: afferte, siquid forte habetis, dicit Rex Iacob.

verses.textEn: Let them approach and announce to us the things that will occur. Announce to us the things that were before. And we will apply our heart to them, and we will know their end. And so, reveal to us the things that will occur.
verses.textLa: Accedant, et nuncient nobis quæcumque ventura sunt: priora quæ fuerunt nunciate: et ponemus cor nostrum, et sciemus novissima eorum, et quæ ventura sunt indicate nobis.

verses.textEn: Announce the things that will occur in the future, and we will know that you are gods. Likewise, accomplish good or evil, if you are able, and let us speak of it and see it together.
verses.textLa: Annunciate quæ ventura sunt in futurum, et sciemus quia dii estis vos. Bene quoque aut male, si potestis, facite: et loquamur, et videamus simul.

verses.textEn: Behold, you exist out of nothing, and your work is from what does not exist; he who has chosen you is an abomination.
verses.textLa: Ecce, vos estis ex nihilo, et opus vestrum ex eo, quod non est: abominatio est qui elegit vos.

verses.textEn: I have raised up one from the north, and he will arrive from the rising of the sun. He will call upon my name, and he will reduce magistrates to mud, like a potter working with clay.
verses.textLa: Suscitavi ab Aquilone, et veniet ab ortu solis: vocabit nomen meum, et adducet magistratus quasi lutum, et velut plastes conculcans humum.

verses.textEn: Who has announced this from its rising, so that we may know it, or from its beginning, so that we may say, “You are just.” There is no one who either announces, or predicts, or hears your words.
verses.textLa: Quis annunciavit ab exordio ut sciamus: et a principio ut dicamus: Iustus es? non est neque annuncians, neque prædicens, neque audiens sermones vestros.

verses.textEn: The first one will say to Zion: “Behold, they are here,” and to Jerusalem, “I will present an evangelist.”
verses.textLa: Primus ad Sion dicet: Ecce adsunt, et Ierusalem evangelistam dabo.

verses.textEn: And I saw, and there was no one among any of them to consult, or who, when I asked, could answer a word.
verses.textLa: Et vidi, et non erat neque ex istis quisquam qui iniret consilium, et interrogatus responderet verbum.

verses.textEn: Behold, they are all unjust, and their works are empty. Their idols are wind and emptiness.
verses.textLa: Ecce omnes iniusti, et vana opera eorum: ventus et inane simulachra eorum.

verses.textEn: Behold my servant, I will uphold him, my elect, with him my soul is well-pleased. I have sent my Spirit upon him. He will offer judgment to the nations.
verses.textLa: Ecce servus meus, suscipiam eum: electus meus, complacuit sibi in illo anima mea: dedi spiritum meum super eum, iudicium gentibus proferet.

verses.textEn: He will not cry out, and he will not show favoritism to anyone; neither will his voice be heard abroad.
verses.textLa: Non clamabit, neque accipiet personam, nec audietur vox eius foris.

verses.textEn: The bruised reed he will not break, and the smoldering wick he will not extinguish. He will lead forth judgment unto truth.
verses.textLa: Calamum quassatum non conteret, et linum fumigans non extinguet: in veritate educet iudicium.

verses.textEn: He will not be saddened or troubled, until he establishes judgment on earth. And the islands will await his law.
verses.textLa: Non erit tristis, neque turbulentus, donec ponat in terra iudicium: et legem eius insulæ expectabunt.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord God, who created the heavens and expanded it, who formed the earth and all that springs from it, who gives breath to the people in it, and spirit to those walking on it.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus creans cælos, et extendens eos: formans terram, et quæ germinant ex ea: dans flatum populo, qui est super eam, et spiritum calcantibus eam.

verses.textEn: I, the Lord, have called you in justice, and I have taken your hand and preserved you. And I have presented you as a covenant of the people, as a light to the Gentiles,
verses.textLa: Ego Dominus vocavi te in iustitia, et apprehendi manum tuam, et servavi te. Et dedi te in fœdus populi, in lucem Gentium:

verses.textEn: so that you may open the eyes of the blind, and lead out the prisoner from confinement and those sitting in darkness from the house of incarceration.
verses.textLa: Ut aperires oculos cæcorum, et educeres de conclusione vinctum, de domo carceris sedentes in tenebris.

verses.textEn: I am the Lord; this is my name. I will not give my glory to another, nor my praise to graven things.
verses.textLa: Ego Dominus, hoc est nomen meum: gloriam meam alteri non dabo, et laudem meam sculptilibus.

verses.textEn: The things that were first, behold, they have arrived. And I also announce what is new. Before these things arise, I will cause you to hear about them.
verses.textLa: Quæ prima fuerunt, ecce venerunt: nova quoque ego annuncio: antequam oriantur, audita vobis faciam.

verses.textEn: Sing to the Lord a new canticle, sing his praise from the ends of the earth, you who descend into the sea and all its fullness, the islands and their inhabitants.
verses.textLa: Cantate Domino canticum novum, laus eius ab extremis terræ: qui descenditis in mare, et plenitudo eius, insulæ, et habitatores earum.

verses.textEn: Let the desert and its cities be lifted up. Kedar will dwell in houses. O inhabitants of the rock, give praise! They will cry out from the top of the mountains.
verses.textLa: Sublevetur desertum, et civitates eius: in domibus habitabit Cedar: laudate habitatores Petræ, de vertice montium clamabunt.

verses.textEn: They will give glory to the Lord, and they will announce his praise to the islands.
verses.textLa: Ponent Domino gloriam, et laudem eius in insulis nunciabunt.

verses.textEn: The Lord will go forth like a strong man; like a man of battle, he will stir up zeal. He will shout and cry out. He will prevail against his enemies.
verses.textLa: Dominus sicut fortis egredietur, sicut vir præliator suscitabit zelum: vociferabitur, et clamabit: super inimicos suos confortabitur.

verses.textEn: I have always been quiet; I have been silent; I have been patient. I will speak like a woman giving birth. I will destroy and consume, all at once.
verses.textLa: Tacui semper, silui, patiens fui, sicut parturiens loquar: dissipabo, et absorbebo simul.

verses.textEn: I will desolate the mountains and the hills, and I will wither all their grass. And I will turn rivers into islands, and I will dry up the pools of water.
verses.textLa: Desertos faciam montes, et colles, et omne gramen eorum exiccabo: et ponam flumina in insulas, et stagna arefaciam.

verses.textEn: And I will lead the blind along a way which they do not know. And I will cause them to walk along paths with which they were unfamiliar. I will turn darkness into light before them, and crooked into straight. These things I have done for them. For I have not abandoned them.
verses.textLa: Et ducam cæcos in viam, quam nesciunt, et in semitis, quas ignoraverunt, ambulare eos faciam: ponam tenebras coram eis in lucem, et prava in recta: hæc verba feci eis, et non dereliqui eos.

verses.textEn: They have been converted again. Let those who trust in graven idols be greatly confounded, for they say to a molten thing, “You are our god.”
verses.textLa: Conversi sunt retrorsum: confundantur confusione qui confidunt in sculptili, qui dicunt conflatili: Vos dii nostri.

verses.textEn: You who are deaf, hear! You who are blind, turn your gaze and see!
verses.textLa: Surdi audite, et cæci intuemini ad videndum.

verses.textEn: Who is blind, except my servant? Who is deaf, except the one to whom I have sent my messengers? Who is blind, except the one who has been sold? And who is blind, except the servant of the Lord?
verses.textLa: Quis cæcus, nisi servus meus? Et surdus, nisi ad quem nuncios meos misi? Quis cæcus, nisi qui venundatus est? Et quis cæcus, nisi servus Domini?

verses.textEn: You who see many things, will you not keep them? You who have open ears, will you not listen?
verses.textLa: Qui vides multa, nonne custodies? Qui apertas habes aures, nonne audies?

verses.textEn: And the Lord was willing to sanctify him, and to magnify the law, and to exalt him.
verses.textLa: Et Dominus voluit ut sanctificaret eum, et magnificaret legem, et extolleret.

verses.textEn: But this same people has robbed and laid waste. All their youth are a snare, and they have been hidden in houses of confinement. They have become victims; there is no one who may rescue them. They have been plundered; there is no one who may say, “Restore.”
verses.textLa: Ipse autem populus direptus, et vastatus: laqueus iuvenum omnes, et in domibus carcerum absconditi sunt: facti sunt in rapinam, nec est qui eruat: in direptionem, nec est qui dicat: Redde.

verses.textEn: Who is there among you who will hear this, who will listen closely and heed this in the future?
verses.textLa: Quis est in vobis qui audiat hoc, attendat et auscultet futura?

verses.textEn: Who has handed over Jacob into plunder, and Israel into devastation? Is it not the Lord himself, against whom we have sinned? And they were not willing to walk in his ways, and they have not listened to his law.
verses.textLa: Quis dedit in direptionem Iacob, et Israel vastantibus? Nonne Dominus ipse, cui peccavimus? Et noluerunt in viis eius ambulare, et non audierunt legem eius.

verses.textEn: And so, he poured out over him the indignation of his fury and a strong battle. And he burned him all around, and he did not realize it. And he set him on fire, and he did not understand it.
verses.textLa: Et effudit super eum indignationem furoris sui, et forte bellum, et combussit eum in circuitu, et non cognovit: et succendit eum, et non intellexit.

verses.textEn: And now thus says the Lord who created you, O Jacob, and who formed you, O Israel: Do not be afraid. For I have redeemed you, and I have called you by your name. You are mine.
verses.textLa: Et nunc hæc dicit Dominus creans te Iacob, et formans te Israel: Noli timere, quia redemi te, et vocavi te nomine tuo: meus es tu.

verses.textEn: When you pass through the waters, I will be with you, and the rivers will not cover you. When you walk through fire, you will not be burned, and the flames will not scorch you.
verses.textLa: Cum transieris per aquas, tecum ero, et flumina non operient te: cum ambulaveris in igne, non combureris, et flamma non ardebit in te:

verses.textEn: For I am the Lord your God, the Holy One of Israel, your Savior. I have presented Egypt as your atonement, Ethiopia and Seba on your behalf.
verses.textLa: Quia ego Dominus Deus tuus Sanctus Israel Salvator tuus, dedi propitiationem tuam Ægyptum, Æthopiam, et Saba pro te.

verses.textEn: Since then, you have become honorable in my eyes, and glorious. I have loved you, and I will present men on behalf of you, and people on behalf of your life.
verses.textLa: Ex quo honorabilis factus es in oculis meis, et gloriosus: ego dilexi te, et dabo homines pro te, et populos pro anima tua.

verses.textEn: Fear not, for I am with you. I will lead your offspring from the East, and I will gather you from the West.
verses.textLa: Noli timere, quia ego tecum sum: ab Oriente adducam semen tuum, et ab Occidente congregabo te.

verses.textEn: I will say to the North, “Release him,” and to the South, “Do not turn him away.” Bring my sons from far away, and my daughters from the ends of the earth.
verses.textLa: Dicam Aquiloni: Da: et Austro: Noli prohibere: affer filios meos de longinquo, et filias meas ab extremis terræ.

verses.textEn: And each one who calls upon my name, I have created for my glory. I have formed him, and I have made him.
verses.textLa: Et omnem, qui invocat nomen meum, in gloriam meam creavi eum, formavi eum, et feci eum.

verses.textEn: Lead forth the people who are blind and have eyes, who are deaf and have ears.
verses.textLa: Educ foras populum cæcum, et oculos habentem: surdum, et aures ei sunt.

verses.textEn: All the nations have been assembled together, and the tribes have been collected. Who among you will announce this, and who will cause us to listen to the things that are first? Let them present their witnesses. Let them act justly, and listen, and say: “It is true.”
verses.textLa: Omnes gentes congregatæ sunt simul, et collectæ sunt tribus: quis in vobis annunciet istud, et quæ prima sunt audire nos faciet? Dent testes eorum, iustificentur, et audiant, et dicant: Vere.

verses.textEn: You are my witnesses, says the Lord, and you are my servant, whom I have chosen, so that you may know, and may believe in me, and so that you may understand that I am the same. Before me, there was no god formed, and after me there will be none.
verses.textLa: Vos testes mei, dicit Dominus, et servus meus, quem elegi: ut sciatis, et credatis mihi, et intelligatis quia ego ipse sum. Ante me non est formatus Deus, et post me non erit.
verses.notes: God is unchanging, existing in eternity, with no before and no after.

verses.textEn: I am. I am the Lord. And there is no savior apart from me.
verses.textLa: Ego sum, ego sum Dominus, et non est absque me salvator.

verses.textEn: I have announced, and I have saved. I have caused it to be heard. And there was no stranger among you. You are my witnesses, says the Lord, and I am God.
verses.textLa: Ego annunciavi, et salvavi: auditum feci, et non fuit in vobis alienus: vos testes mei, dicit Dominus, et ego Deus.

verses.textEn: And from the beginning, I am the same. And there is no one who can rescue from my hand. I act, and who can turn it aside?
verses.textLa: Et ab initio ego ipse, et non est qui de manu mea eruat: operabor, et quis avertet illud?

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: For your sake, I sent to Babylon, and tore down all their bars, with the Chaldeans who glory in their ships.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus Redemptor vester, Sanctus Israel: Propter vos misi in Babylonem, et detraxi vectes universos, et Chaldæos in navibus suis gloriantes.

verses.textEn: I am the Lord, your Holy One, the Creator of Israel, your King.
verses.textLa: Ego Dominus Sanctus vester, Creans Israel Rex vester.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord, who gave you a way through the sea and a path through the torrent of waters,
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus, qui dedit in mari viam, et in aquis torrentibus semitam.

verses.textEn: who led out the chariot and the horse, the column of robust troops. They went to sleep together, and they will not arise. They have been crushed like flax, and they have been extinguished.
verses.textLa: Qui eduxit quadrigam et equum: agmen et robustum, simul obdormierunt, nec resurgent: contriti sunt quasi linum, et extincti sunt.

verses.textEn: You need not call to mind the past, nor consider the things of antiquity.
verses.textLa: Ne memineritis priorum, et antiqua ne intueamini.

verses.textEn: Behold, I am accomplishing new things. And presently, they will spring forth. With certainty, you will know them. I will make a way in the desert, and rivers in an impassible place.
verses.textLa: Ecce ego facio nova, et nunc orientur, utique cognoscetis ea: ponam in deserto viam, et in invio flumina.

verses.textEn: The wild beasts of the field will glorify me, with the serpents and the ostriches. For I have brought waters to the desert, rivers to inaccessible places, in order to give drink to my people, to my elect.
verses.textLa: Glorificabit me bestia agri, dracones et struthiones: quia dedi in deserto aquas, flumina in invio, ut darem potum populo meo, electo meo.

verses.textEn: This is the people whom I have formed for myself. They will speak my praise.
verses.textLa: Populum istum formavi mihi, laudem meam narrabit.

verses.textEn: But you have not called upon me, O Jacob, nor have you struggled for me, O Israel.
verses.textLa: Non me invocasti Iacob, nec laborasti in me Israel.

verses.textEn: You have not offered me the ram of your holocaust, and you have not glorified me with your victims. I have not burdened you with oblations, nor have I wearied you with incense.
verses.textLa: Non obtulisti mihi arietem holocausti tui, et victimis tuis non glorificasti me: non te servire feci in oblatione, nec laborem tibi præbui in thure.

verses.textEn: You have bought me no sweet cane with money, and you have not inebriated me with the fat of your victims. Yet truly, you have burdened me with your sins; you have wearied me with your iniquities.
verses.textLa: Non emisti mihi argento calamum, et adipe victimarum tuarum non inebriasti me. Verumtamen servire me fecisti in peccatis tuis, præbuisti mihi laborem in iniquitatibus tuis.

verses.textEn: I am. I am the very One who wipes away your iniquities for my own sake. And I will not remember your sins.
verses.textLa: Ego sum, ego sum ipse qui deleo iniquitates tuas propter me, et peccatorum tuorum non recordabor.

verses.textEn: Call me to mind, and let us go to judgment together. If you have anything to justify yourself, explain it.
verses.textLa: Reduc me in memoriam, et iudicemur simul: narra si quid habes ut iustificeris.

verses.textEn: Your first father sinned, and your interpreters have betrayed me.
verses.textLa: Pater tuus primus peccavit, et interpretes tui prævaricati sunt in me.

verses.textEn: And so, I have defiled the holy leaders. I have handed over Jacob to slaughter, and Israel to calumny.
verses.textLa: Et contaminavi principes sanctos, dedi ad internecionem Iacob, et Israel in blasphemiam.

verses.textEn: And now, listen, Jacob, my servant, and Israel, whom I have chosen.
verses.textLa: Et nunc audi Iacob serve meus, et Israel quem elegi:

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord, who made and formed you, your Helper from the womb: Do not be afraid, Jacob, my servant and my most righteous, whom I have chosen.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus faciens et formans te, ab utero Auxiliator tuus: noli timere serve meus Iacob, et rectissime, quem elegi.

verses.textEn: For I will pour out waters upon the thirsty ground, and rivers upon the dry land. I will pour out my Spirit upon your offspring, and my benediction upon your stock.
verses.textLa: Effundam enim aquas super sitientem, et fluenta super aridam: effundam spiritum meum super semen tuum, et benedictionem meam super stirpem tuam.

verses.textEn: And they will spring up among the plants, like willows beside running waters.
verses.textLa: Et germinabunt inter herbas quasi salices iuxta præterfluentes aquas.

verses.textEn: This one will say, “I am the Lord’s,” and that one will call himself by the name of Jacob, and yet another will write with his hand, “For the Lord,” and he will take the name Israel.
verses.textLa: Iste dicet: Domini ego sum: et ille vocabit in nomine Iacob, et hic scribet manu sua: Domino: et in nomine Israel assimilabitur.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord, the King and Redeemer of Israel, the Lord of hosts: I am the first, and I am the last, and there is no God apart from me.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus Rex Israel, et Redemptor eius Dominus exercituum: Ego primus, et ego novissimus, et absque me non est Deus.

verses.textEn: Who is like me? Let him call out and announce it. And let him explain to me the order of things, since it is I who appointed the ancient people. The things of the near and the distant future, let him announce them.
verses.textLa: Quis similis mei? Vocet, et annunciet: et ordinem exponat mihi, ex quo constitui populum antiquum: ventura et quæ futura sunt annuncient eis.

verses.textEn: Do not be afraid, and do not be disturbed. From the time when I caused you to listen, I also announced it. You are my witnesses. Is there another God beside me, also a Maker, whom I have not known?
verses.textLa: Nolite timere, neque conturbemini: ex tunc audire te feci, et annunciavi: vos estis testes mei. Numquid est Deus absque me, et formator, quem ego non noverim?

verses.textEn: All of those who create idols are nothing, and their most beloved things will not benefit them. These are their witnesses, for they do not see, and they do not understand, so that they might be confounded.
verses.textLa: Plastæ idoli omnes nihil sunt, et amantissima eorum non proderunt eis. Ipsi sunt testes eorum, quia non vident, neque intelligunt, ut confundantur.

verses.textEn: Who has formed a god or cast a molten image, which is useful for nothing?
verses.textLa: Quis formavit deum, et sculptile conflavit ad nihil utile?

verses.textEn: Behold, all those who partake in this will be confounded. For these makers are men. They will all assemble together. They will stand and be terrified. And they will be confounded together.
verses.textLa: Ecce omnes participes eius confundentur: fabri enim sunt ex hominibus: convenient omnes, stabunt et pavebunt, et confundentur simul.

verses.textEn: The maker of iron has wrought with his file. With coals and hammers, he has formed it, and he has wrought with the strength of his arm. He will hunger and grow faint. He will not drink water, and he will become weary.
verses.textLa: Faber ferrarius lima operatus est: in prunis, et in malleis formavit illud, et operatus est in brachio fortitudinis suæ: esuriet et deficiet, non bibet aquam, et lassescet.

verses.textEn: The maker of wood has extended his ruler. He has formed it with a plane. He has made it with corners, and he has smoothed its curves. And he has made the image of a man, a seemingly beautiful man, dwelling in a house.
verses.textLa: Artifex lignarius extendit normam, formavit illud in runcina: fecit illud in angularibus, et in circino tornavit illud: et fecit imaginem viri quasi speciosum hominem habitantem in domo.

verses.textEn: He has cut down cedars; he has taken the evergreen oak, and the oak that stood among the trees of the forest. He has planted the pine tree, which the rain has nourished.
verses.textLa: Succidit cedros, tulit ilicem, et quercum, quæ steterat inter ligna saltus: plantavit pinum, quam pluvia nutrivit.

verses.textEn: And it is used by men for fuel. He took from it and warmed himself. And he set it on fire and baked bread. But from the remainder, he made a god, and he adored it. He made an idol, and he bowed down before it.
verses.textLa: Et facta est hominibus in focum: sumpsit ex eis, et calefactus est: et succendit, et coxit panes: de reliquo autem operatus est deum, et adoravit: fecit sculptile, et curvatus est ante illud.

verses.textEn: Part of it, he burned with fire, and with part of it, he cooked meat; he boiled food and was filled. And he was warmed, and so he said: “Ah, I am warm. I have gazed at the fire.”
verses.textLa: Medium eius combussit igni, et de medio eius carnes comedit: coxit pulmentum, et saturatus est, et calefactus est, et dixit: Vah, calefactus sum, vidi focum.

verses.textEn: But from its remainder, he made a god and a graven image for himself. He bowed down before it, and he adored it, and he prayed to it, saying: “Free me! For you are my god.”
verses.textLa: Reliquum autem eius deum fecit et sculptile sibi: curvatur ante illud, et adorat illud, et obsecrat, dicens: Libera me, quia deus meus es tu.

verses.textEn: They have neither known nor understood. For their eyes are obscured, lest they see with their eyes and understand with their heart.
verses.textLa: Nescierunt, neque intellexerunt: obliti enim sunt ne videant oculi eorum, et ne intelligant corde suo.

verses.textEn: They do not consider in their mind, nor do they know, nor do they think to say: “I have burned part of it in the fire, and I have baked bread upon its coals. I have cooked flesh and I have eaten. And from its remainder, should I make an idol? Should I fall prostrate before the trunk of a tree?”
verses.textLa: Non recogitant in mente sua, neque cognoscunt, neque sentiunt, ut dicant: Medietatem eius combussi igni, et coxi super carbones eius panes: coxi carnes et comedi, et de reliquo eius idolum faciam? Ante truncum ligni procidam?

verses.textEn: Part of it is ashes. His foolish heart adores it. And he will not liberate his soul, and he will not say, “Perhaps there is a lie in my right hand.”
verses.textLa: Pars eius cinis est: cor insipiens adoravit illud, et non liberabit animam suam, neque dicet: Forte mendacium est in dextera mea.

verses.textEn: Remember these things, O Jacob, O Israel. For you are my servant. I have formed you. You are my servant, Israel. Do not forget me.
verses.textLa: Memento horum Iacob, et Israel, quoniam servus meus es tu. Formavi te, servus meus es tu Israel, ne obliviscaris mei.

verses.textEn: I have wiped away your iniquities like a cloud, and your sins like a mist. Return to me, because I have redeemed you.
verses.textLa: Delevi ut nubem iniquitates tuas, et quasi nebulam peccata tua: revertere ad me, quoniam redemi te.

verses.textEn: Give praise, O heavens! For the Lord has shown mercy. Shout with joy, O ends of the earth! Let the mountains resound with praise, with the forest and all its trees. For the Lord has redeemed Jacob, and Israel will be glorified.
verses.textLa: Laudate cæli, quoniam misericordiam fecit Dominus: iubilate extrema terræ, resonate montes laudationem, saltus et omne lignum eius: quoniam redemit Dominus Iacob, et Israel gloriabitur.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer, and your Maker from the womb: I am the Lord, who makes all things, who alone extends the heavens, who makes the earth firm. And there is no one with me.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus Redemptor tuus, et Formator tuus ex utero: Ego sum Dominus, faciens omnia, extendens cælos solus, stabiliens terram, et nullus mecum.

verses.textEn: I make the signs of the diviners useless, and I turn the seers to madness. I turn the wise backwards, and make their knowledge into foolishness.
verses.textLa: Irrita faciens signa divinorum, et ariolos in furorem vertens. Convertens sapientes retrorsum: et scientiam eorum stultam faciens.

verses.textEn: I lift up the word of my servant, and I fulfill the counsel of my messengers. I say to Jerusalem, “You shall be inhabited,” and to the cities of Judah, “You shall be rebuilt,” and I will lift up its deserts.
verses.textLa: Suscitans verbum servi sui, et consilium nunciorum suorum complens. Qui dico Ierusalem: Habitaberis; et civitatibus Iuda: Ædificabimini, et deserta eius suscitabo.

verses.textEn: I say to the depths, “Be desolate,” and, “I will dry up your rivers.”
verses.textLa: Qui dico profundo: Desolare, et flumina tua arefaciam.

verses.textEn: I say to Cyrus, “You are my shepherd, and you will accomplish all that I will.” I say to Jerusalem, “You shall be built,” and to the Temple, “Your foundations shall be laid.”
verses.textLa: Qui dico Cyro: Pastor meus es, et omnem voluntatem meam complebis. Qui dico Ierusalem: Ædificaberis; et templo: Fundaberis.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord to my anointed Cyrus, whose right hand I hold, so that I may subjugate the nations before his face, and I may turn the backs of kings, and I may open the doors before him, and so that the gates will not be shut.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus christo meo Cyro, cuius apprehendi dexteram, ut subiiciam ante faciem eius Gentes, et dorsa regum vertam, et aperiam coram eo ianuas, et portæ non claudentur.

verses.textEn: I will go before you. And I will humble the glorious ones of the earth. I will shatter the gates of brass, and I will break apart the bars of iron.
verses.textLa: Ego ante te ibo: et gloriosos terræ humiliabo: portas æreas conteram, et vectes ferreos confringam.

verses.textEn: And I will give you hidden treasures and the knowledge of secret things, so that you may know that I am the Lord, the God of Israel, who calls your name.
verses.textLa: Et dabo tibi thesauros absconditos, et arcana secretorum: ut scias quia ego Dominus, qui voco nomen tuum, Deus Israel.

verses.textEn: For the sake of Jacob, my servant, and Israel, my elect, I have even called you by your name. I have taken you up, and you have not known me.
verses.textLa: Propter servum meum Iacob, et Israel electum meum, et vocavi te nomine tuo: assimilavi te, et non cognovisti me.

verses.textEn: I am the Lord, and there is no one else. There is no god beside me. I girded you, and you have not known me.
verses.textLa: Ego Dominus, et non est amplius: extra me non est deus: accinxi te, et non cognovisti me:

verses.textEn: So may those who are from the rising of the sun, and those who are from its setting, know that there is no one beside me. I am the Lord, and there is no other.
verses.textLa: Ut sciant hi, qui ab ortu solis, et qui ab occidente, quoniam absque me non est: ego Dominus, et non est alter,

verses.textEn: I form the light and create the darkness. I make peace and create disaster. I, the Lord, do all these things.
verses.textLa: formans lucem, et creans tenebras, faciens pacem, et creans malum: ego Dominus faciens omnia hæc.
verses.notes: The word ‘malum’ as contrasted with peace is not ‘evil,’ but rather harm or disaster.

verses.textEn: Send down dew from above, O heavens, and let the clouds rain down upon the just! Let the earth open and spring forth a savior! And let justice rise up at once! I, the Lord, have created him.
verses.textLa: Rorate cæli desuper, et nubes pluant iustum: aperiatur terra, et germinet salvatorem: et iustitia oriatur simul: ego Dominus creavi eum.

verses.textEn: Woe to him who contradicts his Maker, a mere shard from an earthen vessel! Should the clay say to the potter, “What are you making?” or, “Your work is not made by your hands?”
verses.textLa: Væ qui contradicit Fictori suo, testa de samiis terræ: numquid dicet lutum figulo suo: Quid facis, et opus tuum absque manibus est?

verses.textEn: Woe to him who says to his father, “Why did you conceive?” or to a woman, “Why did you give birth?”
verses.textLa: Væ qui dicit patri: Quid generas? et mulieri: Quid parturis?

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord, the Holy One of Israel, his Maker: Would you question me about the future, concerning my sons, and command me concerning the work of my hands?
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus, Sanctus Israel, Plastes eius: Ventura interrogate me, super filios meos, et super opus manuum mearum mandate mihi.

verses.textEn: I made the earth, and I created man upon it. My hand stretched out the heavens, and I have commanded all their hosts.
verses.textLa: Ego feci terram, et hominem super eam creavi ego: manus meæ tetenderunt cælos, et omni militiæ eorum mandavi.

verses.textEn: I have raised him up unto justice, and I will direct all his ways. He himself will build my city and release my captives, but not for ransom or gifts, says the Lord, the God of hosts.
verses.textLa: Ego suscitavi eum ad iustitiam, et omnes vias eius dirigam: ipse ædificabit civitatem meam, et captivitatem meam dimittet, non in pretio, neque in muneribus, dicit Dominus Deus exercituum.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord: The labor of Egypt, and the business dealings of Ethiopia, and of the Sabeans, men of stature, will pass to you and will be yours. They will walk behind you. They will travel, bound in irons. And they will adore you and petition you: “In you alone is God, and there is no God apart from you.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus: Labor Ægypti, et negotiatio Æthiopiæ, et Sabaim viri sublimes, ad te transibunt, et tui erunt: Post te ambulabunt, vincti manicis pergent: et te adorabunt, teque deprecabuntur: Tantum in te est Deus, et non est absque te Deus.

verses.textEn: Truly, you are a hidden God, the God of Israel, the Savior.”
verses.textLa: Vere tu es Deus absconditus, Deus Israel Salvator.
verses.notes: This group of persons will be so awed by the true Catholic faith, that they will fall into the error of treating the faithful as if they were gods.

verses.textEn: They have all been confounded and should be ashamed! These fabricators of errors have departed together into confusion!
verses.textLa: Confusi sunt, et erubuerunt omnes: simul abierunt in confusionem fabricatores errorum.

verses.textEn: Israel is saved in the Lord by an eternal salvation. You will not be confounded, and you will not be ashamed, even forever and ever.
verses.textLa: Israel salvatus est in Domino salute æterna: non confundemini, et non erubescetis usque in sæculum sæculi.

verses.textEn: For thus says the Lord, who created the heavens, God himself who formed the earth and made it, the very Molder of it. He did not create it to no purpose. He formed it so that it would be inhabited. I am the Lord, and there is no other.
verses.textLa: Quia hæc dicit Dominus creans cælos, ipse Deus formans terram, et faciens eam, ipse Plastes eius: non in vanum creavit eam: ut habitaretur, formavit eam. Ego Dominus, et non est alius.

verses.textEn: I have not spoken in secret, in a dark place of the earth. I have not said to the offspring of Jacob, “Seek me in vain.” I am the Lord, who speaks justice, who announces what is right.
verses.textLa: Non in abscondito locutus sum, in loco terræ tenebroso: non dixi semini Iacob: Frustra quærite me. Ego Dominus loquens iustitiam, annuncians recta.

verses.textEn: Assemble yourselves, and approach, and draw near together, you who have been saved among the Gentiles. They lack knowledge, who lift up the wood of their sculpture, and who petition a god unable to save.
verses.textLa: Congregamini, et venite, et accedite simul qui salvati estis ex Gentibus: nescierunt qui levant lignum sculpturæ suæ, et rogant deum non salvantem.

verses.textEn: Announce it, and approach, and consult together. Who has caused this to be heard from the beginning, and who has foretold it from that time? Is it not I, the Lord? And is there some other god beside me? I am a just God who saves, and there is no one except me.
verses.textLa: Annunciate, et venite, et consiliamini simul: Quis auditum fecit hoc ab initio, ex tunc prædixit illud? Numquid non ego Dominus, et non est ultra deus absque me? Deus iustus, et salvans non est præter me.

verses.textEn: All ends of the earth, be converted to me, and you will be saved. For I am God, and there is no other.
verses.textLa: Convertimini ad me, et salvi eritis omnes fines terræ: quia ego Deus, et non est alius.

verses.textEn: I have sworn by myself. The Word of justice will proceed from my mouth, and it will not turn back.
verses.textLa: In memetipso iuravi, egredietur de ore meo iustitiæ verbum, et non revertetur:

verses.textEn: For every knee shall bend to me, and every tongue shall swear it.
verses.textLa: quia mihi curvabitur omne genu, et iurabit omnis lingua.

verses.textEn: Therefore, he will say, “In the Lord are my justices and my dominion.” They will go to him. And all who fight against him will be confounded.
verses.textLa: Ergo in Domino, dicet, meæ sunt iustitiæ et imperium: ad eum venient, et confundentur omnes qui repugnant ei.

verses.textEn: In the Lord, all the offspring of Israel will be justified and praised.
verses.textLa: In Domino iustificabitur, et laudabitur omne semen Israel.

verses.textEn: Bel has been broken. Nebo has been crushed. Their idols have been placed upon beasts and cattle, your grievous heavy burdens, even unto exhaustion.
verses.textLa: Confractus est Bel, contritus est Nabo: facta sunt simulachra eorum bestiis et iumentis, onera vestra gravi pondere usque ad lassitudinem.

verses.textEn: They have been melted down, or have been smashed together. They were not able to save the one who carried them, and their life will go into captivity.
verses.textLa: Contabuerunt, et contrita sunt simul: non potuerunt salvare portantem, et anima eorum in captivitatem ibit.

verses.textEn: Listen to me, house of Jacob, all the remnant of the house of Israel, who are carried in my bosom, who were born from my womb.
verses.textLa: Audite me domus Iacob, et omne residuum domus Israel, qui portamini a meo utero, qui gestamini a mea vulva.

verses.textEn: Even to your old age, I am the same. And even with your grey hairs, I will carry you. I have made you, and I will sustain you. I will carry you, and I will save you.
verses.textLa: Usque ad senectam ego ipse, et usque ad canos ego portabo: ego feci, et ego feram: ego portabo, et salvabo.

verses.textEn: To whom would you liken me, or equate me, or compare me, or consider me to be similar?
verses.textLa: Cui assimilastis me, et adæquastis, et comparastis me, et fecistis similem?

verses.textEn: You take gold from a bag, and you weigh silver on a scale, so as to hire a goldsmith to make a god. And they fall prostrate and adore.
verses.textLa: Qui confertis aurum de sacculo, et argentum statera ponderatis: conducentes aurificem, ut faciat deum: et procidunt, et adorant.

verses.textEn: They carry him on their shoulders, supporting him, and they set him in his place. And he will stand still and will not move from his place. But even when they will cry out to him, he will not hear. He will not save them from tribulation.
verses.textLa: Portant illum in humeris gestantes, et ponentes in loco suo: et stabit, ac de loco suo non movebitur. Sed et cum clamaverint ad eum, non audiet: de tribulatione non salvabit eos.

verses.textEn: Remember this, and be confounded. Return, you transgressors, to the heart.
verses.textLa: Mementote istud, et confundamini: redite prævaricatores ad cor.

verses.textEn: Remember the past ages. For I am God, and there is no other god. There is no one like me.
verses.textLa: Recordamini prioris sæculi, quoniam ego sum Deus, et non est ultra deus, nec est similis mei:

verses.textEn: From the beginning, I announce the last things, and from the start, the things that have not yet been done, saying: My plan will stand firm, and my entire will shall be done.
verses.textLa: Annuncians ab exordio novissimum, et ab initio quæ necdum facta sunt, dicens: Consilium meum stabit, et omnis voluntas mea fiet:

verses.textEn: I call a bird from the east, and from a far away land, the man of my will. And I have spoken it, and I will carry it out. I have created, and I will act.
verses.textLa: Vocans ab Oriente avem, et de terra longinqua virum voluntatis meæ. Et locutus sum, et adducam illud: creavi, et faciam illud.

verses.textEn: Hear me, you who are hard of heart, who are far from justice!
verses.textLa: Audite me duro corde, qui longe estis a iustitia.

verses.textEn: I have brought my justice near. It will not be far away, and my salvation will not be delayed. I will grant salvation in Zion, and my glory in Israel.
verses.textLa: Prope feci iustitiam meam, non elongabitur, et salus mea non morabitur. Dabo in Sion salutem, et in Israel gloriam meam.

verses.textEn: Descend, sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of Babylon! Sit on the ground. There is no throne for the daughter of the Chaldeans. For you shall no longer be called delicate and tender.
verses.textLa: Descende, sede in pulvere virgo filia Babylon, sede in terra: non est solium filiæ Chaldæorum, quia ultra non vocaberis mollis et tenera.

verses.textEn: Take a millstone and grind meal. Uncover your shame, bare your shoulder, reveal your legs, cross the streams.
verses.textLa: Tolle molam, et mole farinam: denuda turpitudinem tuam, discooperi humerum, revela crura, transi flumina.

verses.textEn: Your disgrace will be revealed, and your shame will be seen. I will seize vengeance, and no man will withstand me.
verses.textLa: Revelabitur ignominia tua, et videbitur opprobrium tuum: ultionem capiam, et non resistet mihi homo.

verses.textEn: Our Redeemer, the Lord of hosts is his name, the Holy One of Israel.
verses.textLa: Redemptor noster, Dominus exercituum nomen illius, Sanctus Israel.

verses.textEn: Sit in silence, and enter into darkness, O daughter of the Chaldeans! For you shall no longer be called the noblewoman of kingdoms.
verses.textLa: Sede tacens, et intra in tenebras filia Chaldæorum: quia non vocaberis ultra domina regnorum.

verses.textEn: I was angry with my people. I have polluted my inheritance, and I have given them into your hand. You have not shown mercy to them. You have greatly increased the burden of your yoke upon the elders.
verses.textLa: Iratus sum super populum meum, contaminavi hereditatem meam, et dedi eos in manu tua: non posuisti eis misericordias: super senem aggravasti iugum tuum valde.

verses.textEn: And you have said: “I will be a noblewoman forever.” You have not set these things upon your heart, and you have not remembered your end.
verses.textLa: Et dixisti: In sempiternum ero domina: non posuisti hæc super cor tuum, neque recordata es novissimi tui.

verses.textEn: And now, hear these things, you who are delicate and have confidence, who say in your heart: “I am, and there is no one greater than me. I will not sit as a widow, and I will not know barrenness.”
verses.textLa: Et nunc audi hæc delicata, et habitans confidenter, quæ dicis in corde tuo: Ego sum, et non est præter me amplius: non sedebo vidua, et ignorabo sterilitatem.

verses.textEn: These two things will suddenly overwhelm you in one day: barrenness and widowhood. All things shall overwhelm you, because of the multitude of your sorceries and because of the great cruelty of your enchantments.
verses.textLa: Venient tibi duo hæc subito in die una, sterilitas et viduitas. Universa venerunt super te, propter multitudinem maleficiorum tuorum, et propter duritiam incantatorum tuorum vehementem.
verses.notes: This refers to false mystics, false seers, false prophets, and false religious leaders, and the false worship which accompanies them.

verses.textEn: And you have trusted in your malice, and you have said: “There is no one who sees me.” Your wisdom and your knowledge, these have deceived you. And you have said in your heart: “I am, and beside me there is no other.”
verses.textLa: Et fiduciam habuisti in malitia tua, et dixisti: Non est qui videat me. Sapientia tua et scientia tua hæc decepit te. Et dixisti in corde tuo: Ego sum, et præter me non est altera.

verses.textEn: Evil will overwhelm you, and you will not notice its rising. And calamity will fall violently over you, and you will not be able to avert it. You will suddenly be overwhelmed by a misery such as you have never known.
verses.textLa: Veniet super te malum, et nescies ortum eius: et irruet super te calamitas, quam non poteris expiare: veniet super te repente miseria, quam nescies.

verses.textEn: Stand with your incantations, and with the multitude of your sorceries, in which you have labored from your youth, as if somehow it might benefit you, or as if it were able to make you stronger.
verses.textLa: Sta cum incantatoribus tuis, et cum multitudine maleficiorum tuorum, in quibus laborasti ab adolescentia tua, si forte quod prosit tibi, aut si possis fieri fortior.

verses.textEn: You have failed in the multitude of your plans! Let the seers stand and save you, those who were contemplating the stars, and figuring the months, so that from these they might announce to you the things to come.
verses.textLa: Defecisti in multitudine consiliorum tuorum: stent, et salvent te augures cæli, qui contemplabantur sidera, et supputabant menses, ut ex eis annunciarent ventura tibi.

verses.textEn: Behold, they have become like stubble. Fire has consumed them. They will not free themselves from the power of the flames. These are not coals by which they may be warmed, nor is this a fire which they may sit beside.
verses.textLa: Ecce facti sunt quasi stipula, ignis combussit eos: non liberabunt animam suam de manu flammæ: non sunt prunæ, quibus calefiant, nec focus, ut sedeant ad eum.

verses.textEn: So have all these things, in which you have labored, become to you. Your merchants from your youth, each one has erred in his own way. There is no one who can save you.
verses.textLa: Sic facta sunt tibi in quibuscumque laboraveras: negotiatores tui ab adolescentia tua, unusquisque in via sua erraverunt: non est qui salvet te.

verses.textEn: Listen to these things, O house of Jacob, you who are called by the name of Israel, and who went forth from the waters of Judah. You swear by the name of the Lord and you call to mind the God of Israel, but not in truth, and not in justice.
verses.textLa: Audite hæc domus Iacob, qui vocamini nomine Israel, et de aquis Iuda existis, qui iuratis in nomine Domini, et Dei Israel recordamini non in veritate, neque in iustitia.

verses.textEn: For they have been called from the holy city, and they have been founded upon the God of Israel. The Lord of hosts is his name.
verses.textLa: De civitate enim sancta vocati sunt, et super Deum Israel constabiliti sunt: Dominus exercituum nomen eius.

verses.textEn: From that time, I announced the former things. They went forth from my mouth, and I have caused them to be heard. I wrought these things suddenly, and they were fulfilled.
verses.textLa: Priora ex tunc annunciavi, et ex ore meo exierunt, et audita feci ea: repente operatus sum, et venerunt.

verses.textEn: For I knew that you are stubborn, and that your neck is like an iron sinew, and that your forehead is like brass.
verses.textLa: Scivi enim quia durus es tu, et nervus ferreus cervix tua, et frons tua ærea.

verses.textEn: From that time, I foretold to you. Before these things happened, I revealed them to you, lest you say: “My idols have accomplished these things, and my graven and molten images have commanded them.”
verses.textLa: Prædixi tibi ex tunc: antequam venirent indicavi tibi, ne forte diceres: Idola mea fecerunt hæc, et sculptilia mea, et conflatilia mandaverunt ista.

verses.textEn: See all the things that you have heard. But were you the ones who announced them? From that time, I caused you to hear about new things, and you do not know how these were preserved.
verses.textLa: Quæ audisti, vide omnia: vos autem num annunciastis? Audita feci tibi nova ex tunc, et conservata sunt quæ nescis:

verses.textEn: They are created now, and not in that time. And even before today, you did not hear of them; otherwise, you might say, “Behold, I knew them.”
verses.textLa: nunc creata sunt, et non ex tunc: et ante diem, et non audisti ea, ne forte dicas: Ecce ego cognovi ea.

verses.textEn: You have neither heard, nor known, nor were your ears open in that time. For I knew that you would transgress greatly, and so I called you a transgressor from the womb.
verses.textLa: Neque audisti, neque cognovisti, neque ex tunc aperta est auris tua: scio enim quia prævaricans prævaricaberis, et transgressorem ex utero vocavi te.

verses.textEn: For the sake of my name, I will take the face of my fury far away. And for the sake of my praise, I will bridle you, lest you perish.
verses.textLa: Propter nomen meum longe faciam furorem meum: et laude mea infrenabo te, ne intereas.

verses.textEn: Behold, I have refined you, but not like silver. I have chosen you for the furnace of poverty.
verses.textLa: Ecce excoxi te, sed non quasi argentum, elegi te in camino paupertatis.

verses.textEn: For my sake, for my own sake, I will do it, so that I may not be blasphemed. For I will not give my glory to another.
verses.textLa: Propter me, propter me faciam, ut non blasphemer: et gloriam meam alteri non dabo.

verses.textEn: Listen to me, O Jacob, and Israel whom I call. I am the same, I am the first, and I am the last.
verses.textLa: Audi me Iacob, et Israel quem ego voco: ego ipse, ego primus, et ego novissimus.

verses.textEn: Also, my hand has founded the earth, and my right hand has measured the heavens. I will call them, and they will stand together.
verses.textLa: Manus quoque mea fundavit terram, et dextera mea mensa est cælos: ego vocabo eos, et stabunt simul.

verses.textEn: Gather together, all of you, and listen. Who among them has announced these things? The Lord has loved him; he will do his will with Babylon, and his arm is upon the Chaldeans.
verses.textLa: Congregamini omnes vos, et audite: quis de eis annunciavit hæc? Dominus dilexit eum, faciet voluntatem suam in Babylone, et brachium suum in Chaldæis.

verses.textEn: I am, I have spoken, and I have called him. I have led him forward, and his way has been straight.
verses.textLa: Ego, ego locutus sum, et vocavi eum: adduxi eum, et directa est via eius.

verses.textEn: Draw near to me, and listen to this. From the beginning, I have not spoken in secret. From the time before it happened, I was there. And now, the Lord God has sent me, and his Spirit.
verses.textLa: Accedite ad me, et audite hoc: non a principio in abscondito locutus sum: ex tempore antequam fieret, ibi eram: et nunc Dominus Deus misit me, et spiritus eius.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord, your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: I am the Lord, your God, who teaches you beneficial things, who guides you in the way that you walk.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus, Redemptor tuus, Sanctus Israel: Ego Dominus Deus tuus docens te utilia, gubernans te in via, qua ambulas.

verses.textEn: If only you had paid attention to my commandments! Your peace would have been like a river, and your justice would have been like the waves of the sea,
verses.textLa: Utinam attendisses mandata mea: facta fuisset sicut flumen pax tua, et iustitia tua sicut gurgites maris,

verses.textEn: and your offspring would have been like the sand, and the stock from your loins would have been like its stones. His name would not have passed away, nor would it have been worn away before my face.
verses.textLa: et fuisset quasi arena semen tuum, et stirps uteri tui ut lapilli eius: non interisset, et non fuisset attritum nomen eius a facie mea.

verses.textEn: Depart from Babylon! Flee from the Chaldeans! Announce it with a voice of exultation. Cause it to be heard, and carry it even to the ends of the earth. Say: “The Lord has redeemed his servant Jacob.”
verses.textLa: Egredimini de Babylone, fugite a Chaldæis, in voce exultationis annunciate: auditum facite hoc, et efferte illud usque ad extrema terræ. Dicite: Redemit Dominus servum suum Iacob.

verses.textEn: They did not thirst in the desert, when he led them out. He produced water from the rock for them. For he split the rock, and the waters flowed out.
verses.textLa: Non sitierunt in deserto, cum educeret eos: aquam de petra produxit eis, et scidit petram, et fluxerunt aquæ.

verses.textEn: “There is no peace for the impious,” says the Lord.
verses.textLa: Non est pax impiis, dicit Dominus.

verses.textEn: Pay attention, you islands, and listen closely, you far away peoples. The Lord has called me from the womb; from the womb of my mother, he has been mindful of my name.
verses.textLa: Audite insulæ, et attendite populi de longe: Dominus ab utero vocavit me, de ventre matris meæ recordatus est nominis mei.

verses.textEn: And he has appointed my mouth as a sharp sword. In the shadow of his hand, he has protected me. And he has appointed me as an elect arrow. In his quiver, he has hidden me.
verses.textLa: Et posuit os meum quasi gladium acutum: in umbra manus suæ protexit me, et posuit me sicut sagittam electam: in pharetra sua abscondit me.

verses.textEn: And he has said to me: “You are my servant, Israel. For in you, I will glory.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit mihi: Servus meus es tu Israel, quia in te gloriabor.

verses.textEn: And I said: “I have labored toward emptiness. I have consumed my strength without purpose and in vain. Therefore, my judgment is with the Lord, and my work is with my God.”
verses.textLa: Et ego dixi: In vacuum laboravi, sine causa, et vane fortitudinem meam consumpsi: ergo iudicium meum cum Domino, et opus meum cum Deo meo.

verses.textEn: And now, says the Lord, who formed me from the womb as his servant, so that I may bring back Jacob to him, for Israel will not be gathered together, but I have been glorified in the eyes of the Lord and my God has become my strength,
verses.textLa: Et nunc dicit Dominus, formans me ex utero servum sibi, ut reducam Iacob ad eum, et Israel non congregabitur: et glorificatus sum in oculis Domini, et Deus meus factus est fortitudo mea.

verses.textEn: and so he has said: “It is a small thing that you should be my servant so as to raise up the tribes of Jacob, and so as to convert the dregs of Israel. Behold, I have offered you as a light for the Gentiles, so that you may be my salvation, even to the furthest regions of the earth.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit: Parum est ut sis mihi servus ad suscitandas tribus Iacob, et fæces Israel convertendas: Ecce dedi te in lucem Gentium, ut sis salus mea usque ad extremum terræ.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel, his Holy One, to a contemptible soul, to an abominable nation, to the servant of lords: The kings will see, and the princes will rise up, and they will adore, because of the Lord. For he is faithful, and he is the Holy One of Israel, who has chosen you.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus, Redemptor Israel, Sanctus eius, ad contemptibilem animam, ad abominatam gentem, ad servum dominorum: Reges videbunt, et consurgent principes, et adorabunt propter Dominum, quia fidelis est, et Sanctum Israel qui elegit te.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord: In a pleasing time, I have heeded you, and in the day of salvation, I have assisted you. And I have preserved you, and I have presented you as a covenant of the people, so that you would lift up the earth, and possess the scattered inheritances,
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus: In tempore placito exaudivi te, et in die salutis auxiliatus sum tui: et servavi te, et dedi te in fœdus populi, ut suscitares terram, et possideres hereditates dissipatas:

verses.textEn: so that you would say to those who are bound, “Go forth!” and to those who are in darkness, “Be released!” They will pasture along the roads, and their pastures will be in every open place.
verses.textLa: ut diceres his, qui vincti sunt: Exite: et his, qui in tenebris: Revelamini. Super vias pascentur, et in omnibus planis pascua eorum.

verses.textEn: They will not hunger or thirst, nor will the heat of the sun beat down upon them. For the one who takes pity on them will rule them, and he will give them to drink from fountains of waters.
verses.textLa: Non esurient, neque sitient, et non percutiet eos æstus et sol: quia miserator eorum reget eos, et ad fontes aquarum potabit eos.

verses.textEn: And I will make all my mountains into a road, and my paths will be exalted.
verses.textLa: Et ponam omnes montes meos in viam, et semitæ meæ exaltabuntur.

verses.textEn: Behold, some will come from far away, and behold, others from the north and from the sea, and still others from the land of the south.
verses.textLa: Ecce isti de longe venient, et ecce illi ab Aquilone et mari, et isti de terra australi.

verses.textEn: Give praise, O heavens! And exult, O earth! Let the mountains give praise with jubilation! For the Lord has consoled his people, and he will take pity on his poor ones.
verses.textLa: Laudate cæli, et exulta terra, iubilate montes laudem: quia consolatus est Dominus populum suum, et pauperum suorum miserebitur.

verses.textEn: And Zion said: “The Lord has abandoned me, and the Lord has forgotten me.”
verses.textLa: Et dixit Sion: Dereliquit me Dominus, et Dominus oblitus est mei.

verses.textEn: Can a woman forget her infant, so as not to take pity on the child of her womb? But even if she would forget, still I shall never forget you.
verses.textLa: Numquid oblivisci potest mulier infantem suum, ut non misereatur filio uteri sui? Et si illa oblita fuerit, ego tamen non obliviscar tui.

verses.textEn: Behold, I have engraved you on my hands. Your walls are always before my eyes.
verses.textLa: Ecce in manibus meis descripsi te: muri tui coram oculis meis semper.

verses.textEn: Your builders have arrived. Those who would tear you down and destroy you, they will depart from you.
verses.textLa: Venerunt structores tui: destruentes te, et dissipantes a te exibunt.

verses.textEn: Lift up your eyes all around, and see: all these have been gathered together; they have come to you. As I live, says the Lord, you shall be clothed with all these things, as if with an ornament. And like a bride, you shall wrap these things all around you.
verses.textLa: Leva in circuitu oculos tuos, et vide, omnes isti congregati sunt, venerunt tibi: vivo ego, dicit Dominus, quia omnibus his velut ornamento vestieris, et circumdabis tibi eos quasi sponsa.

verses.textEn: For your deserts, and your solitary places, and the land of your ruination will now be too narrow, because of all the inhabitants. And those who devoured you will be chased far away.
verses.textLa: Quia deserta tua, et solitudines tuæ, et terra ruinæ tuæ nunc angusta erunt præ habitatoribus, et longe fugabuntur qui absorbebant te.

verses.textEn: Even the children of your barrenness will say in your ears: “This place is too narrow for me. Make me a spacious place in which to dwell.”
verses.textLa: Adhuc dicent in auribus tuis filii sterilitatis tuæ: Angustus est mihi locus, fac spatium mihi ut habitem.

verses.textEn: And you will say in your heart: “Who has conceived them? I was barren and unable to give birth. I was taken away and held captive. And so, who has raised them? I was destitute and alone. And so, where have they been?”
verses.textLa: Et dices in corde tuo: Quis genuit mihi istos? Ego sterilis, et non pariens, transmigrata, et captiva: et istos quis enutrivit? Ego destituta et sola: et isti ubi erant?

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will lift up my hand to the Gentiles, and I will exalt my sign before the peoples. And they will carry your sons in their arms, and they will bear your daughters on their shoulders.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus: Ecce levabo ad Gentes manum meam, et ad populos exaltabo signum meum. Et afferent filios tuos in ulnis, et filias tuas super humeros portabunt.

verses.textEn: And kings will be your caretakers, and queens will be your nursemaids. They will reverence you with their face to the ground, and they will lick the dust at your feet. And you will know that I am the Lord. For those who hope in him will not be confounded.
verses.textLa: Et erunt reges nutritii tui, et reginæ nutrices tuæ: vultu in terram demisso adorabunt te, et pulverem pedum tuorum lingent. Et scies quia ego Dominus, super quo non confundentur qui expectant eum.

verses.textEn: Can prey be taken from the strong? Or is anything taken captive by the powerful able to be saved?
verses.textLa: Numquid tolletur a forti præda? Aut quod captum fuerit a robusto, salvum esse poterit?

verses.textEn: For thus says the Lord: Certainly, even the captives will be taken away from the strong, even what has been taken by the powerful will be saved. And truly, I will judge those who have judged you, and I will save your children.
verses.textLa: Quia hæc dicit Dominus: Equidem, et captivitas a forti tolletur: et quod ablatum fuerit a robusto, salvabitur. Eos vero, qui iudicaverunt te, ego iudicabo, et filios tuos ego salvabo.

verses.textEn: And I will feed your enemies their own flesh. And they will be inebriated with their own blood, as with new wine. And all flesh will know that I am the Lord, who saves you, and your Redeemer, the Strong One of Jacob.
verses.textLa: Et cibabo hostes tuos carnibus suis: et quasi musto, sanguine suo inebriabuntur: et sciet omnis caro, quia ego Dominus salvans te, et Redemptor tuus, Fortis Iacob.

verses.textEn: Thus says the Lord: What is this bill of divorce for your mother, by which I have dismissed her? Or who is my creditor, to whom I have sold you? Behold, you were sold by your iniquities, and I have dismissed your mother for your wickedness.
verses.textLa: Hæc dicit Dominus: Quis est hic liber repudii matris vestræ, quo dimisi eam? Aut quis est creditor meus, cui vendidi vos? Ecce in iniquitatibus vestris venditi estis, et in sceleribus vestris dimisi matrem vestram.

verses.textEn: For I arrived, and there was no man. I called out, and there was no one who would hear. Has my hand been shortened and become small, so that I am unable to redeem? Or is there no power in me to deliver? Behold, at my rebuke, I will make the sea into a desert. I will turn rivers into dry land. The fish will rot for lack of water and will die of thirst.
verses.textLa: Quia veni, et non erat vir: vocavi, et non erat qui audiret. Numquid abbreviata et parvula facta est manus mea, ut non possim redimere? Aut non est in me virtus ad liberandum? Ecce in increpatione mea desertum faciam mare, ponam flumina in siccum: computrescent pisces sine aqua, et morientur in siti.

verses.textEn: I will clothe the heavens in darkness, and I will make sackcloth their covering.
verses.textLa: Induam cælos tenebris, et saccum ponam operimentum eorum.
